wikipedia_page.main: Ian Kenneth Black (born 14 March 1985) is a Scottish former professional footballer, who played as a central midfielder. His clubs included Inverness Caledonian Thistle, Heart of Midlothian, Rangers, Shrewsbury Town and Blackpool. Black made one appearance for Scotland in August 2012, despite playing at that time in the Scottish Third Division for Rangers.

*Ian Black is an ex-Scotland internationalist, having played with Heart of Midlothian and Rangers.  He played for Dunbar United from March 2020 until June 2021.

Thomson was appointed for the 2012 Scottish Cup final, which was won 5–1 by Hearts against their Edinburgh derby rivals Hibernian. During the match, Thomson failed to send off Hearts midfielder Ian Black for elbowing Hibs striker Leigh Griffiths and also awarded a penalty to Hearts for a foul which television replays showed had taken place outside the box.

response: On 11 September, Jelavić scored his first Rangers goal against Hamilton Academical at New Douglas Park after he headed in a Kyle Lafferty cross. On 21 September, Jelavić played against Dunfermline Athletic in the League Cup, scoring two goals in the game including an overhead kick in a 7–2 win for Rangers. In Rangers next away match to Aberdeen at Pittodrie, Jelavić scored what the winning goal in a 3–2 Rangers win. Rangers were 2–0 down before coming back to win the match with Jelavić scoring the third Rangers goal. The next week Jelavić was injured in a match against Hearts at Tynecastle, suffering ankle ligament damage due to a tackle by Hearts midfielder Ian Black. Jelavić claimed that Black had intended to injure him, a charge denied by his opponent, who apologized for the challenge. He scored two goals in a match against Dundee United in October 2011.
